== Potential candidates ==
  +
=== Mohamed Hosni Mubarak ===
  +   +
Now is the main candidate, and the only number one for the NDP in the next presidential election, what passion does not overcome the love of power parenting, and decides its time to leave his inheritance to his son Gamal Mubarak, who will stand in this case of the National Party, of course.
  +   +
=== Omar Suleiman ===
  +
Is the head of Egyptian Intelligence, and plays an important role in mediation between Palestinian factions as well as coordination between the Palestinians and the Israelis
  +   +
Many in Egypt believe that the security services Kalmkhabrat and state security are to govern the state effectively and guide the presidential Almwsssp
  +   +
Been put forward Omar Suleiman as a candidate for the presidency by some writers and intellectuals as an alternative to the idea of bequeathing power to Gamal Mubarak
  +   +
=== Gamal Mubarak ===
  +   +
Gamal Mubarak did not specify the position so far from the elections, in 2011, leaving the door open to the rumors.
  +   +
On the other hand, a number of forces, and national popular movements and opposition political parties in [[Egypt]] is sharply critical of the regime, accusing him of seeking "to pass Gamal Mubarak, President of the Republic" to replace his father, and many of those parties and opposition parties opposed to what it describes as "the inheritance scheme ".
  +   +
The afternoon is another one of the elite of Egyptian youth to defend Gamal Mubarak and his right to his chair in Egypt.
  +   +
=== Mohamed ElBaradei ===
  +   +
In November 2009 and in the midst of political controversy over the election of the presidency of the Republic due in Egypt in 2011 and constitutional impediments placed in front of candidates under the amended Article 76 in 2007 and speculation about the escalation of the son of President Hosni Mubarak, Mohamed ElBaradei, for his possible candidacy for the presidential elections in Egypt, the condition of the Declaration resolution unequivocally the existence of "written assurances" about the integrity and freedom of the electoral process. ElBaradei said in a television interview he conducted with CNN News America: "I will study the possibility of running for presidential candidate in Egypt, if any written guarantees that the electoral process will be free and fair."
  +   +
Declaration ElBaradei has elicited mixed reactions in the Egyptian political street, where some consider an embarrassing message to the regime of the weight of an international character that the process of devolution of power in Egypt need to be reviewed. While others felt that the UN nuclear watchdog is a real effort to open new horizons for political life "strangulated" in Egypt. According to the recipe.
  +   +
ElBaradei said in a statement sent from his office in Vienna for the newspaper [[Al-Shorouk (Egyptian newspaper)|Al-Shorouk]] '''"He did not announce willingness or unwillingness to participate in the upcoming presidential election"'''<ref name="ElBaradei will clear his position on the presidency after November">[http://www.shorouknews.com/ContentData.aspx?id=136398 ElBaradei will clear his position on the presidency after November]</ref>. He said the office manager: {{Quotation|That Dr. ElBaradei is the end of November next director-general [[International Atomic Energy Agency | of the International Atomic Energy Agency]], and therefore, interest is currently devoted to his work and to address important issues and topics addressed by the Agency, so he did not take any decision regarding his future , which will be decided in light of developments and developments in the next phase.}}
  +   +
The [[New Wafd Party | Al-Wafd Party]] and other opposition political forces, has announced that it is ready to support ElBaradei said decided to run.
  +   +
=== Ahmed Zewail ===
  +   +
What about the rumors about the existence of an ambitious politician with a "I am a frank man .. I have no political ambition, as I stressed repeatedly that I want to serve Egypt in the field of science and die and I am the world."<ref name="Zewail: I have no political ambitions .. I would like a scientist in the service of Egypt only">[http://www.shorouknews.com/ContentData.aspx?id=133290 Zewail: I have no political ambitions .. I would like a scientist in the service of Egypt only]</ref>
  +   +
=== Amr Moussa ===
  +   +
To put him to run for president [[Egypt]], but he did not deny his intention to run for office also did not rule out, leaving the field open to expectations, and argued that "the right of every citizen has the capacity and efficiency that aspires to the office would bring him to contribute to the service of the nation"<ref name="Amr Moussa opened the way for speculation before his candidacy for the presidency of Egypt">[http://arabic.cnn.com/2009/middle_east/10/20/Amro.Mousa/ Amr Moussa opened the way for speculation before his candidacy for the presidency of Egypt]</ref>.He further stated separately to the press that the qualities to be met by President of the Republic also apply to [[Gamal Mubarak]], son of President [[Egypt | Egypt]] [[Mohamed Hosni Mubarak]], and citizenship, rights and obligations apply to and can apply to you as can be applied to [[Gamal Mubarak]]<ref name="Amr Moussa did not rule out running for the presidency of Egypt">[http://ara.reuters.com/article/topNews/idARACAE59I1E020091020 Amr Moussa did not rule out running for the presidency of Egypt]</ref>. He also expressed appreciation "for the confidence expressed by many people when they talk about his candidacy for the presidency, and the confidence Iaatarbha cherished, and it has it that the letter reached him."<ref name="Amr Mousa told (Al-Shorouk): the right of every qualified citizen can aspire to serve the country and look for the presidency">[http://www.shorouknews.com/ContentData.aspx?id=143426 Amr Mousa told (Al-Shorouk): the right of every qualified citizen can aspire to serve the country and look for the presidency]</ref>.
  +   +

== Criticisms of the 2011 Presidential Election Arrangements ==
  +
=== Election monitoring ===
  +   +
This election will not be under any court supervision and was rejected international supervision of these elections as Secretary-General said Assistant Secretary of the policies in the [[National Democratic Party]]''''Gamal Mubarak, in a press conference'' ' "This is governed by the law and the Constitution, which made it possible for civil society organizations monitoring the elections "'''. The Secretary of Education in the party [[Mohamed Kamal]] that the party welcomes the scrutiny of national organizations, but he refuses to international control, saying that the abolition of judicial supervision of elections does not affect its integrity. The'' ' "Most of the world where there is no judicial supervision of elections, however, be fair and impartial ."''' <ref name="Â«National Democratic PartyÂ» emphasizes the unity of the parliamentary majority to reap ... And rejects any international monitoring of elections">[http://international.daralhayat.com/internationalarticle/72415 Â«National Democratic PartyÂ» emphasizes the unity of the parliamentary majority to reap ...
